title: Croix de Belledonne
text:
Croix de Belledonne, at , is one of the highest points in the <a href="Belledonne">Belledonne</a> range in the <a href="French%20Alps">French Alps</a>, close to the highest summit in the range, <a href="Grand%20Pic%20de%20Belledonne">Grand Pic de Belledonne</a> at . The name derives from the cross erected on the summit ("croix" means cross in French ).
Geography.
Located in the <a href="Departments%20of%20France">department</a> of <a href="Is%C3%A8re">Isère</a>, Croix of Belledonne is one of the highest summits in the <a href="Belledonne">Belledonne</a> range.
History.
The first ascension is estimated to have taken place around 1850.
The gap separating the Croix de Belledonne from the Central Peak is named after the <a href="alpinist">alpinist</a> <a href="Henry%20Duhamel">Henry Duhamel</a>
